alert.note: Alert for Iroquois (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 31 at 8:16AM CST until February 01 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois and Indiana... Des Plaines River near Russell affecting Lake (IL) County. Iroquois River at Iroquois affecting Iroquois and Newton Counties. Kankakee River at Shelby affecting Newton and Lake (IN) Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Iroquois River from near US-41 downstream to the confluence with Sugar Creek at Watseka, including the Iroquois gauge. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, agricultural areas near the river begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CST Wednesday, the stage was 18.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and will continue to fall thereafter. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 230 AM CST.
